words.definition: An artery is a tube that carries blood from the heart.
words.example: Eating too much fat can block your arteries.

words.definition: Deterioration is the process of becoming worse.
words.example: The deterioration of the building was clear to see.

words.definition: If something or someone is elusive, they are hard to find or catch.
words.example: The elusive cat was nowhere to be found.

words.definition: To forage means to search for food.
words.example: The animals foraged for food in the forest.

words.definition: To impede means to slow down or prevent the progress of something.
words.example: The snow impeded our progress.

words.definition: To induce means to cause something to happen.
words.example: The medicine induced sleep.

words.definition: If things are inseparable, they cannot be separated.
words.example: The two friends were inseparable.

words.definition: If something is invalid, it is not legally or officially acceptable.
words.example: The contract was declared invalid.

words.definition: To magnify something means to make it look bigger than it is.
words.example: A microscope magnifies very small things.

words.definition: Mainstream is what is considered normal or common.
words.example: His ideas were once considered radical, but they are now mainstream.

words.definition: A microbe is a very small living thing that can only be seen with a microscope.
words.example: Some microbes cause diseases.

words.definition: If something is negligible, it is so small that it is not important.
words.example: The cost of the repairs was negligible.

words.definition: Paralysis is the loss of the ability to move all or part of the body.
words.example: The accident left him with permanent paralysis.

words.definition: A pest is an animal or insect that causes damage or is annoying.
words.example: Rats are common pests in many cities.

words.definition: To prevail means to win or be successful.
words.example: Good will always prevail over evil.

words.definition: Respiration is the act of breathing.
words.example: The doctor checked his respiration.

words.definition: To rupture means to burst or break suddenly.
words.example: The pipe ruptured, causing a flood.

words.definition: If something is savage, it is very violent and cruel.
words.example: The wolf was a savage animal.

words.definition: To stun someone means to shock or surprise them very much.
words.example: The news stunned everyone.

words.definition: If you are susceptible to something, you are easily affected by it.
words.example: She is susceptible to colds in the winter.
